about_the_game:
Club House on Haunted Hill is a story-driven, adventure golf game that blends golf and narrative in the style of a 1960s horror movie. As you play the story you navigate through the haunted lands of the Island of Gallows Neck, each course telling a piece of the overall story.

In addition to the campaign you will be able to play against friends locally or online on various haunted golf courses. Each hole offers an adventure filled with supernatural elements and horrifying hazards enhancing the challenge.





Distribute points in Muscle, Cunning, Control, Mercy, and Sanity to create the perfect golfer tailored to your play style. You can max out muscle to have the longest drive, or put points in sanity to withstand the psychological terror of golf.







Cunning enhances your ability to judge distances and predict ball landings. With a sharp cunning of the game you'll be able to anticipate the ball's trajectory and make strategic decisions to outmaneuver your opponents.


Mercy increases good hit chances, even with off-target hits. Giving you a better chance of landing successful shots, even when your timing isn't perfect.


Sanity improves ball spin and loft control. By mastering this attribute, you can execute complex shots with precision, allowing you to navigate obstacles and fine-tune the ball’s spin.


Muscle determines how hard you will hit the ball and how far it will travel. This attribute gives you an edge on long fairways and challenging your competitors with powerful shots.

content_descriptors.notes:
Club House on Haunted Hill draws heavily from classic 1960s horror films, so expect a similar vibe when it comes to mature content. There's no nudity or sexual content in the game. The strongest language you'll hear is along the lines of "damn" and "hell," keeping it mild, much like a movie from the 1950s.

Some characters may be seen smoking or appearing intoxicated. As for violence and gore, it’s presented in a campy, over-the-top style that's more playful than frightening. Think along the lines of exaggerated horror movie effects—blood and gore are there, but it's all in good fun and not meant to be realistic or frightening.

We aim for the same experience as old classic horror, without crossing into anything too intense or realistic.
